Planned changes to improve safety [40 CFR 68.155(f)]:

The site is completing the action plans from the site compliance audit of all 3 RMP process areas and the five-year PHA Review for the Laydown Area. Action plans have been developed and are tracked on a monthly basis.

The five-year accident history [40 CFR 68.155(d)]:

There are no incidents that meet the criteria for the RMP five year accident history. 

The emergency response program [40 CFR 68.155(e)]:

Nouryon Functional Chemicals LLC is subject to various Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) and United States Environmental Protection Agency (USEPA) emergency response program regulations.  A detailed written emergency response plan has been developed and addresses how we would promptly and efficiently respond to onsite emergencies.

All onsite Emergency Response Team members are trained in accordance with federal emergency response training requirements given at 29 CFR 1910.120; quarterly and annual emergency response training is conducted to maintain the overall readiness of the emergency response personnel and equipment.  The site conducts frequent real-time emergency drills with exercises involving simulated hazardous material releases.  Nouryon is a member of the Channel Industries Mutual Aid (CIMA) Association, and participates in an annual drill involving member CIMA companies.  Our site also undergoes periodic site inspections by CIMA to ensure our overall level of emergency response readiness.

Should an emergency event ever occur onsite, the public would be informed of the event by a representative of Nouryon Functional Chemicals by placing a recorded message on the local Community Awareness Emergency Response line (online system). Pre-Startup Safety Review [PSSR] [40 CFR Part 68.77]
Pre-start up safety reviews related to new processes and modifications to existing processes are conducted routinely at Nouryon Pasadena. These reviews are conducted to confirm that construction, equipment, operating, and maintenance procedures are suitable for safe startup prior to placing equipment into operation.

Compliance Audits [40 CFR Part 68.79]
Nouryon conducts audits on a regular basis to determine whether the provisions set out under the US EPA RMP and OSHA PSM regulations are being implemented. These audits are conducted at least every 3 years and any corrective actions required as a result of the audits are undertaken in a prompt manner.

Incident Investigation [40 CFR Part 68.81]
Nouryon promptly investigates any incident that has resulted in, or could reasonably result in a catastrophic release of a regulated substance. These investigations are undertaken to identify the situation leading to the incident as well as any corrective actions to prevent the release from reoccurring. All reports are retained for a minimum period of 5 years.

Employee Participation [40 CFR Part 68.83]
Nouryon believes that Process Safety Management and accident prevention is a team effort. Employees are strongly encouraged to express their views concerning accident prevention issues and to recommend improvements. In addition, Nouryon employees have access to all information created as part of the facility's implementation of the RMP and PSM rules, including information resulting from Process Hazard Analyses in particular.

Hot Work Permit [40 CFR Part 68.85]
Nouryon has a hot work permit that requires issuance of a hot work permit for hot work operations conducted on or near the covered process.

The studies are undertaken by a team of qualified personnel with expertise in engineering and process operations and are revalidated at a regular interval of 5 years. Written Operating Procedures [40 CFR Part 68.69]
To ensure safe operations, Nouryon maintains detailed written operating procedures. These procedures address various modes of operation such as initial startup, normal operations, temporary operations, emergency shutdown, emergency operations and normal shutdown. The information is regularly reviewed and is readily accessible to operators involved in the processes.

Employee Training [40 CFR Part 68.71]
Nouryon has a comprehensive training program in place to ensure that employees who are operating plant processes are competent in the applicable operating procedures. Refresher training is provided at least every three years and more frequently as needed.

Mechanical Integrity [40 CFR Part 68.73]
Nouryon carries out documented maintenance checks on process equipment to ensure proper operations. Inspected process equipment include pressure vessels, storage tanks, piping systems, pressure relief and vent systems, emergency shutdown systems, controls, and pumps. Maintenance operations are carried out by qualified personnel with previous training in maintenance practices. Furthermore, these personnel are offered specialized training as needed. Any equipment deficiencies identified by the maintenance checks are corrected in a safe and timely manner.

The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source [40 CFR 68.155(a)]:

Nouryon is strongly committed to employee, public and environmental safety. This commitment is demonstrated by our comprehensive accidental release prevention program that encompasses design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance, and employee training. Robust engineering controls are in place to prevent possible releases of regulated substances. The Pasadena facility is a responding facility for releases of the RMP-listed chemicals, so the site utilizes an Emergency Response Plan.

The stationary source and regulated substances handled [40 CFR 68.155(b)]:

Nouryon Functional Chemicals LLC produces a variety of products at our Pasadena, Texas facility - organic peroxides for the plastic manufacturing industry.  The facility has three covered processes that use regulated chemicals above the applicability threshold: an organic peroxide manufacturing process contains a diked 2-methyl-1-butene bulk storage tank (RMP flammable chemical); a laydown area contains a 2-methyl-1-butene bulk storage tank (RMP flammable chemical); and another organic peroxide manufacturing process utilizes a refrigerated building for drum storage of isopropyl chloroformate (RMP toxic chemical).
